summary: SummaryHighlightsVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackKISS Falscara False Eyelash Rosewater Remover provides gentle, easy removal of Falscara Wisps and Bond & Seal.
details: DetailsFeaturesInfused with soothing rosewaterNourishes the eye areaItem 2559006How To UseShake Well Before Use.Take a cotton pad and saturate with the remover.Place over eyes; hold for 10 seconds to let the remover work its magic!Gently wipe away to remove wisps and Bond & Seal.Clean & Reuse Wisps:Step 1: Place WISPS on a cotton pad or paper towel. 2. Drop some remover onto the wisps. Let sit for 10 seconds.Saturate a cotton swab with remover & work gently to wipe away any Bond & Seal residue on the wisps.IngredientsWater, Cyclopentasiloxane, Cyclohexasiloxane, Lsohexadecane, Butylene Glycol, Rosa Damascena Flower Water, Sodium Citrate, Benzalkonium Chloride, Cetrimonium Chloride, Benzyl Alcohol, Poloxamer 184, Disodium EDTA, Citric Acid, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Glycyrrhiza Glabra (licorice) Root Extract, Chamomilla Recutita (matricaria) Flower/leaf Extract, Isopropyl Alcohol, Portulaca Oleracea Extract, Phenoxyethanol, Fragrance, Red 40.
how_to_use: Shake Well Before Use.Take a cotton pad and saturate with the remover.Place over eyes; hold for 10 seconds to let the remover work its magic!Gently wipe away to remove wisps and Bond & Seal.Clean & Reuse Wisps:Step 1: Place WISPS on a cotton pad or paper towel. 2. Drop some remover onto the wisps. Let sit for 10 seconds.Saturate a cotton swab with remover & work gently to wipe away any Bond & Seal residue on the wisps.

reviews.headline: Get something else
reviews.comments: I tried using this first only to remove the glue and realized it wasnt wirking. Had to use an oil cleanser and then go back in with this to really get everything off. Im missing so many lashes.

reviews.headline: If you have issues removing falscara glue, get this
reviews.comments: I prefer this wayyyy more than usual micellar water, it works better to remove the adhesive. Takes a few swipes but with a soaked cotton pad, it'll rub off in no time

reviews.headline: wish I could give this no stars
reviews.comments: i bought this thinking it was the same falscara remover as the one that comes in the DIY kit because i really like that one. They are not alike, this one burned my skin. Its been over 10 hours and my skin still stings. My entire top and lower eye lids are pink, patchy and scaly. I cannot cover it with makeup bc the skin is now super sensitive. Extremely upset :(

reviews.headline: The best for falsecara glue removal!
reviews.comments: This works really well at removing all glue left on natural lashes after taking off under lash clusters. I cannot believe how inexpensive it is too! I use mine on something that doesn't shed fuzzies. No burning or skin irritation ever!

reviews.headline: Removes eye makeup.
reviews.comments: Love how easily it removes eye makeup. Hold over eye for 10 seconds, then wipe. That simple.

reviews.headline: Do not use! Burns so bad!
reviews.comments: This took off some of my lashes but not all and burned while doing it. My eyes felt swollen for two days after and it made the skin around my eyes dry and damaged.  I was very scared it could do permanent damage if I kept using it so I stopped. Do not recommend.

reviews.headline: I would buy this again
reviews.comments: I've always had such a hard time taking the glue off my lashes. This product works wonders, 4 stars because of its opening. Not the easiest to squeeze out, and doesn't give much when squeezing.

reviews.headline: Red 40
reviews.comments: It does remove bond and seal but takes about 10 mins.. causes eye irritation even after I rinse with water afterwards. My eyes are dry the next day!! Also noticed red 40 is an ingredient. Do better!!

reviews.headline: For Falscara Lashes
reviews.comments: If you wear Falscara lashes and bond, I definitely recommend this cleanser to remove the lashes and the leftover bond. Its pretty easy to use and the lashes come off easily. The only downside is that if you get it in your eye, it makes your vision blurry and weird.

reviews.headline: I found a better remover
reviews.comments: Elf holy hydration makeup melting cleansing balm removes way better, I've tried other oils and methods but I swear it takes me one minute to get that sticky crap off with the balm

reviews.headline: Maybe I'm lucky?
reviews.comments: Ngl I ALMOST returned this product because of the reviews but im glad I didn't. Maybe I got lucky idk but my lash clusters came off extremely quick? I used a qtip and soaked it in a lot of product and than began rubbing the outside parts of the lashes gently and then doing the same thing on my eyelid area where the clusters were and after 10 minutes of gently rubbing i began to spin my qtip as if i was curling my lashes and they easily popped off without leaving my lids bald üòÇ

reviews.headline: Ummmm hello?
reviews.comments: Followed directions to a T and norhjnf. 10 seconds, 20 seconds, left the soaked cotton swab on my eyelid and nothing. I guess you get what you pay for! Garbage!

reviews.headline: Be patient
reviews.comments: I start off by shaking the bottle then saturating a cotton pad. Press the cotton pad onto your eyelashes for a few seconds and wiggle it. The eyelashes will come off. I take the residual glue off with a qtip. I also use this for waterproof mascara.

reviews.headline: Don't buy
reviews.comments: I did as the instructions said to but it didnt work. I tried for 30 minutes hoping to see results but noting happened. Wont buy again.

reviews.headline: A must have!!
reviews.comments: This stuff is a must with fake eyelashes!!! It makes taking them off so easy and saves your natural lashes.

reviews.headline: Not new and improved like it says
reviews.comments: Bad product did not remove much of any makeup

reviews.headline: The Best Lash Glue Remover
reviews.comments: In my opinion, I think this is the best eyelash glue remover. I have tried Olive oil, baby oil Vaseline, baby shampoo, i've tried everything and this is the best!

reviews.headline: Works for me.
reviews.comments:
This has so far worked better than any other remover for me. I have VERY sensitive skin and unlike other users, I've had no issues with it. I use a soaked cotton ball (wet but not dripping) to place on my falscara lashes (eye closed) for about 5-10 secs and then gently swipe down with minimal pressure. Voila! Lashes slide right off. Afterwards, I use a qtip soaked in a bit of the remover to get any residue left at the lashline. 
I don't wear false lashes often, but when i do they are usually falscara and always removed with this remover. 
I did only give it 4 stars instead of 5 since the price point is well over what it should be comparatively and if i wore false lashes more often, it would be too expensive to buy regularly.

Left me with redness under my eye

faceoff_positive.comments: I received this product complimentary from information and Kiss. I really love the fact that this was included in my voxbox package. The only thing I would say about this product is that I cleaned Lashes off with alcohol before and water to reuse them so I really feel like this is not a product that I would buy however I really like the fact that kiss products was very intentional on creating a specific lash remover designed specifically for lashes to have a long lasting effect for reuse. I definitely want to provide an honest review as I don√¢‚Ç¨:tm:t want to receive something and just say how great it is but also to give my constructive feedback but otherwise it√¢‚Ç¨:tm:s Lashes off with alcohol before and water to reuse them so I really feel like this is not a product that I would buy however I really like the fact that kiss products was very intentional on creating a specific lash remover designed specifically for lashes to have a long lasting effect for reuse. I definitely want to provide an honest review as I don√¢‚Ç¨:tm:t want to receive something and just say how great it is but also to give my constructive feedback but otherwise it√¢‚Ç¨:tm:s A great product and I would recommend buying it for someone who specifically wants to purchase lash remover otherwise this is a product that may not be needed by some. However thank you so much Influenster and kiss for this product!
faceoff_positive.headline: Great product!

faceoff_negative.comments:
I tried Kiss Falscara lashes for the first time this weekend, and it was kinda scary! 

Okay, so, first off you have to attach them in little pieces. It√¢‚Ç¨:tm:s not one strip of lash. Second, they are placed underneath your existing lash and not on top. I was a little afraid this would make my narrow eyes look even more closed but it didn√¢‚Ç¨:tm:t. 

They look a lot like extensions and blended amazingly well. Super easy to put on and not mess up. The downside? I had a lot of residue on my natural lashes when I took them off and I didn√¢‚Ç¨:tm:t like how it felt. I also thought getting the residue off was pretty rough on my existing lashes. Soaking the lashes in remover several times wasn√¢‚Ç¨:tm:t enough, so I had to rub them gently until all the funk came off. Kinda scary to see a natural lash or two come loose and fall out. 

I√¢‚Ç¨:tm:m a little on the fence about this product and I think I√¢‚Ç¨:tm:ll give them one more shot before deciding if I like them enough to keep using them or not.
faceoff_negative.headline: Not as effective as I wanted!
